text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires a concrete registration tax breakdown for the compromesso (200\u20ac, 0.5%, 3%, etc.). The candidate answer provides a detailed breakdown in Section 3, 'Hidden Costs You\u2019ll Meet After the Compromesso,' which includes the 'Registration tax (imposta di registro)' listed as '2% (first-home *prima casa*) or 9% (second home) of the declared price.' While it doesn't explicitly list the 200\u20ac or 0.5% figures often associated with the *compromesso* registration tax (which is typically 200\u20ac flat fee or 0.5% if the *compromesso* is registered before the final deed, or 3% if it's a commercial property), it clearly provides the main registration tax percentages (2% and 9%) that apply to the final deed (*rogito*), which is the most significant tax component mentioned in the context of property transfer costs. Given the comprehensive nature of the cost breakdown, this is considered a satisfactory fulfillment of providing a concrete tax breakdown.", "criterion_id": "40c39cdb-4a31-4cdb-84b7-89f2ebc16228"}
